thread.title: Dog discovered curled up on road where owner was killed by truck
thread.title_full: Dog discovered curled up on road where owner was killed by truck | Examiner.com

author: Penny Eims
title: Dog discovered curled up on road where owner was killed by truck
text:
Grieving Twitter Screenshot R. Colburn Fox 17 reported on a sad scene discovered on Chaffee Road in Jacksonville, Florida, early Friday morning where a woman was struck by a tractor-trailer and dragged to her death. The woman, identified as 42-year-old Kelly Black, is believed to have been walking her dog, "Paco," when she was hit and killed.
Black's faithful dog curled up on the road and stayed there for hours after Black's body was removed. Russell Colburn, with Action Jax News, made the following Tweet about the heartbreaking scene several hours ago, " Kelly & Paco were inseparable. Paco was by her side when she died & stayed here, alone, after."
Surviving family members eventually arrived to the accident scene to retrieve Black's grieving dog. The person who was driving the tractor-trailer left the scene. It is unknown if the driver is aware that they struck and killed a person early this morning.
Local authorities are continuing to investigate the deadly incident.
